pageContext.claim: “And yet, you wanted to fix a pothole in a roadway or in a highway in this country, and you didn't do it because they didn't have the money because so much money was spent in the Middle East.”
pageContext.analysis: There is no question that there are a lot of potholes and that a lot of them could be fixed, but the idea that none are fixed because of overseas spending is nonsense. If the government wanted to fix every pothole, it would cost a fraction of what the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq cost.
